Description: Body and foot fragment of Attic black-glazed pottery cup or bowl; wholly glazed save for groove on stand-ring of tall foot. Inside, four bands of rouletting around central motif of eight linked stamped palmettes. Graffito under foot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bryn Mawr, the Art and Artifact Collections. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1883)
